Key Match Events: Buddy Hield recorded 22 points to help the Golden State Warriors get off on a winning note.
Steph Curry contributed a double-double with 17 points and 10 assists.
The Warriors took control in the second half, leading by 20 points heading into the fourth quarter.
The game ended with a score of 139-104 in favor of the Golden State Warriors.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams showed intent and energy as a high-octane scoring contest ensued.
The Warriors started with Steph Curry and Andrew Wiggins in the backcourt.
The Blazers fielded Anfernee Simons and Deni Avdija as their guards.
Post-Match Reflections: The lack of floor balance and communication played a key role in Portland's loss.
The visitors will be pleased to have nailed most of their game plans early on in the season.
